definitions.definition: a room, set of rooms, or building used as a place for commercial, professional, or bureaucratic work.
examples: computers first appeared in offices in the late 1970s
synonyms: cubicle; informalsalt mine(s) "her office on Union Street"

definitions.definition: the local center of a large business.
examples: a company that has four U.S. and four European offices

definitions.definition: a room, department, or building used to provide a particular service.
the consulting room of a professional person.
a position of authority, trust, or service, typically one of a public nature.
synonyms: capacity "he assumed the office of mayor"

definitions.definition: tenure of an official position, especially a government position.
examples: a year ago, when the president took office

definitions.definition: the quarters, staff, or collective authority of a particular government department or agency.
a service or kindness done for another person or group of people.
a duty attaching to one's position; a task or function.
synonyms: aegis "he was saved by the good offices of his uncle"

definitions.definition: the series of services of prayers and psalms said (or chanted) daily by Roman Catholic priests, members of religious orders, and other clergy.
a prayer service conducted daily as part of the Divine Office.
